item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: They are ripping up the footpath for New lay boy, 2nd June
item.description:
It is on the corner of Philly Lane Lampton Road I reported this last week and still nothing has been done. It’s a public footpath which should be kept open yeah I started work again today. They did some work last week. I hope this problem will be sorted out today or tomorrow because children are back at school.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dead Man's Incline, Shurdington, Tewkesbury

item.title: Overgrown trees and bushes damaging private property, 1st June
item.description:
Number 1 Compton Close Churchdown Gloucester Gl3 1NY. The trees used to get felled regularly haven’t been done for a longtime. The last time these were left they collapsed into our garden. The trees are causing our fence to bow along with the overgrown bushes the other side. It’s also taking out natural light.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Compton Close, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disabled access on pavement removed, 1st June
item.description:
The newly created Co Op on Pilley Lane has removed disabled access from the pavement. As you'll see from the attached photographs, the dropped kerb has been entirely removed meaning that anyone in a wheelchair or on a mobility scooter is pushed into the road as they won't be able to navigate it. Please can this be sorted as a matter of urgency; people are already being forced into the road by blocked pavements. When the Co op opens the traffic problems experienced on Leckhampton Road will be transferred here - there has been nothing put in the plans to alleviate these - and it is going to make the road even more dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Pilley Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pothole, 31st May
item.description:
